intro: Viola yedoensis f. albescens, commonly known as the White Viola, is a cultivated form of the Japanese violet. It is characterized by its pale white to cream-colored flowers, which contrast with its dark green, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–15 cm and prefers cool, moist environments. It is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in early spring. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and shaded borders.
